title: No. 1 Lynx mount 17-point rally to oust Valkyries
content: The top-seeded Lynx rallied from a 17-point third-quarter deficit to beat the Valkyries 75-74 and advance to the next round of the WNBA playoffs.

title: Dodgers considering Ohtani helping as reliever
content: Dave Roberts said the Dodgers have talked about Shohei Ohtani pitching out of the bullpen in the playoffs. As for playing in the outfield, as Ohtani said Tuesday he'd be willing to do, Roberts said that won't happen.

title: Liberty 'embarrassed' by Mercury in 26-point rout
content: The reigning WNBA champion Liberty are a loss away from playoff elimination after getting what star Breanna Stewart said was "embarrassed" by the Phoenix Mercury 86-60 on Wednesday night.

title: Sources: Messi, Miami near multiyear extension
content: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami are nearing a final agreement on a new multiyear contract with the deal expected to be completed soon, sources told ESPN.

title: Commanders given final approval for D.C. return
content: The Commanders' return to Washington is finally official as the District of Columbia Council voted 11-2 in favor of the measure once more -- an expected outcome given its vote more than a month ago but one that faced some brief uncertainty Wednesday.

title: NCAA removes spring transfer window for football
content: The NCAA voted to eliminate the spring transfer portal window but did not sign off on establishing Jan. 2-11 as the lone window for FBS and FCS players.

title: Johnson: I'm not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: Cards' Murray sorry for post with Vick jersey, dog
content: Cardinals quarterback Kyler Murray took down an Instagram post that included a photo of him wearing a Michael Vick jersey while posing with one of his bulldogs, saying that he "in no way, shape or form" condones dogfighting.

title: ♥️ Cardi B, Stefon Diggs expecting child
content: The Patriots wide receiver and Grammy Award-winning rapper have been spotted in public with each other since February.

title: What MLB aces look like in 2025 compared to past decades
content: Paul Skenes and Tarik Skubal are having great seasons within the context of modern baseball. But how do they compare to aces of the past? Let's find out.

title: 'They're done building around him': Inside the tumultuous Kawhi Leonard era in Los Angeles
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: No run game in Kansas City? Poor O-lines in Houston, Minnesota? Real-or-not ratings for every team
content: Which shocking early statistical trends have staying power, and which are a product of a small sample size?

title: What we're hearing: Latest on Aaron Rodgers, Bengals' plans without Joe Burrow
content: Our insiders have intel on Rodgers' first two games in Pittsburgh, Cincinnati's post-Burrow scramble and more.

title: How to pull off a major college football upset in five (not so) easy steps
content: Not all upsets are created equal, but when upsets like NIU-Notre Dame or others happen, they have some common traits.

title: Bottom 10: Where the teams aren't hot, but the coaches' seats are
content: The head coaches at UCLA and Virginia Tech already are toast -- and the temperature is rising for others.

title: What happens to a college football roster when a coach is fired in September?
content: UCLA and Virginia Tech fired their coaches Sunday after Week 3 of the college football season. What's next?

title: Bowling Green's unofficial mascot: Pudge the cat
content: Bowling Green may have a former Heisman Trophy winner for a coach, but the biggest star on this team is a cat.

title: Can the Giants afford to sit Jaxson Dart for the whole year? Here are the benefits
content: Dart's job is to sit and learn behind Russell Wilson. Can the Giants stay patient and let him develop?

title: Isak might be the new star, but Salah remains Liverpool's main man after latest Anfield thriller
content: Alexander Isak made his Liverpool debut, but it was Mo Salah and another helping of late-game magic that lifted the Reds over Atletico Madrid in the Champions League.

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- and falling -- after two weeks? Here's our fresh 1-32 Power Rankings poll
content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

title: The John Cena eras: From Ruthless Aggression to 17-time WWE champ
content: We highlight the key moments from Cena's remarkable 23-year career before he retires the jorts in December.

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: Crawford takes top spot; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford delivered an impressive performance and moved up, but what about Canelo Alvarez? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Way-Too-Early Grand Slam predictions for 2026
content: The majors are done for the year -- is it too early to forecast who will reign supreme in 2026? Never.

title: 'It's a violent play': Why the rest of the NFL isn't using the tush push
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: How farming and family forged Eagles center Cam Jurgens
content: Cam Jurgens led the Eagles to a Super Bowl title while playing with a herniated disc. If that sounds tough, wait until you hear about his dad and a scraggly barn cat.

title: Matchup rankings: Javonte Williams, DK Metcalf stand out in Week 3
content: Matchups are the key to fantasy lineup decisions. Here are the most and least favorable for Week 3 at QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Rest-of-season rankings: Adams, Jones climb; Jeanty drops
content: Eric Karabell updates his rankings at every position for the rest of the season, including his top 100 overall.

title: Arsenal show at Athletic that they possess the depth to win UCL
content: Subs Gabriel Martinelli and Leandro Trossard powered Arsenal past Athletic Club on Tuesday, showing off the depth needed to win the Champions League.

title: Champions League recap: 10-man Madrid defeat Marseille, Juve draw with Dortmund
content: Here's how Tuesday's action unfolded. Real Madrid hung on, while Juventus and Dortmund provided entertainment.

title: MVP Tracker 4.0: Chawinga, Esther fighting for the crown
content: Less than 25% of the NWSL regular season is left, and the race to be crowned the league's MVP is heating up.

title: Who are the breakout U21 Champions League players you don't know?
content: With a host of young players in the Champions League squads, we look at the next breakout stars under the age of 21 this season.

title: Is Mbappé the quickest Real Madrid player to 50 goals? Not even close
content: Kylian Mbappé is the fastest player to reach a half-century of goals for Real Madrid since Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid looking at Paz return
content: Real Madrid are reportedly looking to bring back former player Nico Paz. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: The blue line all-breakout team: Byram, Drysdale lead the next generation on D
content: Prepare for your fantasy hockey draft with these defensemen in the right situation to have a break out season.

title: Defence pact: Pak-Saudi declare joint response to any aggression; India reacts
content: Saudi Arabia and Pakistan have formalized their long-standing security cooperation by signing a 'Strategic Mutual Defense Agreement'. This pact pledges mutual support against external aggression, marking a significant shift towards an institutionalized military framework. The agreement aims to enhance defense cooperation and strengthen joint deterrence, though Saudi officials clarify it's not linked to recent regional conflicts or any specific country.

title: NRI, 71, reaches Ludhiana from US to marry UK groom; body found in pieces in nullah
content: A shocking crime unfolded in Ludhiana as a 71-year-old NRI was allegedly murdered by a man hired by her UK-based fiancé. Rupinder Kaur, who traveled from the US for marriage, was reportedly killed by Sukhjit Singh at the behest of Charanjit Singh, who backed out of the marriage.

title: BMW crash: Gaganpreet admitted herself to ICU, filed ‘false’ MLC 5 hours after accident
content: Gaganpreet Makkad, accused in the BMW accident that killed a finance ministry official, argued in court that the incident wasn't criminally motivated, claiming she tried to save Navjot Singh. Her judicial custody was extended, and the court will review CCTV footage.

title: Lights, camera, shut down! Who is Jimmy Kimmel? Star host fired after remarks on Kirk
content: Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show, Jimmy Kimmel Live!, has been suspended indefinitely by ABC following controversial remarks he made about the death of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk. The suspension came after criticism from the FCC and major TV station owners, who threatened fines and license revocation. Donald Trump praised the decision, further shrinking the presence of liberal-leaning late-night television.

title: Rashid Latif backs Saim Ayub after third duck – 'bade game me phod dega'
content: Pakistan secured a spot against India in the Asia Cup after defeating the UAE, but Saim Ayub's batting slump continued with his third consecutive duck. Despite the concerns surrounding his batting performance, former captain Rashid Latif defended Ayub, emphasising his valuable contributions with the ball. Latif predicted Ayub would perform well in the upcoming high-stakes match against India in Dubai.

title: How Tata became Apple's biggest Indian ‘weapon’ against China
content: Tata Electronics has become a major beneficiary of Apple's strategic shift to manufacture iPhones in India, with revenue increasing significantly. The company now accounts for nearly half of India's iPhone production, driven by exports to the US, which constitute a substantial portion of Tata Electronics' revenue. This pivot was accelerated by Trump's tariff policies and Apple's commitment to US investments.

title: 'We’ve got a problem': Obama blasts Trump’s ‘dangerous’ rhetoric
content: Barack Obama cautioned that the U.S. faces a critical juncture, criticizing Donald Trump's exploitation of political violence. He highlighted Trump's rhetoric and his administration's actions as divisive, urging citizens to defend democratic values. Obama contrasted his approach with Trump's norm-breaking use of executive power, emphasizing the need for civility and unity.

title: 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' suspended indefinitely over Charlie Kirk remarks; Trump mocks 'total losers'
content: Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show has been suspended by ABC following his controversial remarks regarding Charlie Kirk's murder. Nexstar Media Group, which oversees numerous ABC affiliates, ceased broadcasting the show in response to Kimmel's comments, deeming them offensive and insensitive. The FCC chair condemned the remarks, suggesting potential action against ABC affiliates, while the White House celebrated the suspension.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos says he is proud of his salary package
content: Jeff Bezos, Amazon's founder, revealed he never accepted additional compensation as CEO, forgoing stock grants and bonuses due to his significant ownership. He advocated measuring success by wealth created for others, citing Amazon's $2.3 trillion market cap. Bezos joins other tech leaders like Mark Zuckerberg and Warren Buffett in prioritizing value creation over personal enrichment, reflecting a Silicon Valley ethos.

title: Uttarakhand cloudburst: 10 missing, 6 buildings collapse in Chamoli
content: A devastating cloudburst struck Kuntari Lagafali in Nandanagar, causing widespread destruction and collapsing six buildings. Five people are missing, while two were rescued by locals. Rescue operations are underway with SDRF and NDRF teams on-site, and a medical team with ambulances has been dispatched to provide assistance. The administration is closely monitoring the situation as rescue efforts continue.

title: Handshake row: PCB's emails to ICC, close door meeting & Pycroft's non-apology
content: Amidst uncertainty surrounding Pakistan's Asia Cup participation, the PCB demanded match referee Andy Pycroft's removal, alleging code of conduct violations during the India-Pakistan match, specifically regarding the captains not shaking hands. Despite PCB's threats, the ICC stood firm, asserting Pycroft followed ACC instructions and didn't violate any rules.

title: 155 ft long table, exquisite menu: Inside Trump's royal dinner at Windsor Castle
content: Donald Trump attended a state banquet in the UK. The event took place at Windsor Castle. King Charles III and Queen Camilla hosted the banquet. The menu included watercress panna cotta and chicken ballotine. Rupert Murdoch and several tech leaders were among the guests. Trump spoke about the special relationship between the US and UK.

title: ‘I’m disappointed’: Nvidia CEO on China AI chip halt; CAC orders firms to terminate deals
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed disappointment over China's directive to its tech giants, including ByteDance and Alibaba, to halt purchases of Nvidia's AI chips like the RTX Pro 6000D. This ban extends beyond previous restrictions and signals China's confidence in its domestic AI processors.

title: Disha Patani Bareilly home firing: How cops hunted down, encountered Goldy Brar gang members
content: In a joint operation, Noida STF and Delhi Police killed two alleged criminals linked to the firing at Disha Patani's Bareilly home. Ravindra and Arun, members of the Goldy Brar-Rohit Godara gang, died in an encounter in Ghaziabad. The attack followed a social media controversy involving Patani's sister, Khushboo, and remarks misattributed to a spiritual figure.

title: 'Should I break law ?': Kash Patel faces heat in Epstein files hearing
content: FBI Director Kash Patel faced intense questioning from the House Judiciary Committee regarding the handling of Jeffrey Epstein files, leading to heated exchanges with lawmakers over transparency and the release of information. Patel defended the FBI's actions, citing legal constraints and previous disclosures, while Democrats accused him of obstruction and cover-up.

title: US immigration court orders Mahmoud Khalil deportation to Syria or Algeria
content: An immigration judge in Louisiana has ordered the deportation of pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil, a legal permanent resident, to Syria or Algeria. Khalil's lawyers plan to appeal, citing concerns about a swift and unfavorable process. This ruling contrasts with a federal court order blocking his deportation while considering his claim of retaliation for his advocacy.

title: 'Andy Pycroft is India's favourite' - Ex-Pak captain blasts ICC referee
content: Former PCB chairman Ramiz Raja has accused ICC match referee Andy Pycroft of bias towards India, citing his frequent appointments for Indian matches. This follows a handshake controversy after a heated India-Pakistan clash at the Asia Cup in Dubai. The PCB alleged Pycroft prohibited handshakes, a claim the ICC refutes, attributing the issue to a venue manager's error.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,400; Sensex up over 350 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday on positive global cues following US Federal Reserve rate cut move. While Nifty50 went above 25,400, BSE Sensex was up over 350 points.

title: Strangled her, kept body in car for a day: Killer cop buries wife 170km away
content: Constable Deepak Kumar Rout murdered his wife, Subhamitra Sahoo, a traffic constable, after financial disputes arose from a ₹10 lakh loan. Rout strangled her in his car, buried her body in Keonjhar, and then visited a temple, even taking selfies. He initially misled police, but WhatsApp chats and a polygraph test exposed his deception, leading to his confession.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan join India in Super 4s; Group B fight goes down to the wire
content: Pakistan defeated UAE by 41 runs, securing their spot in the Asia Cup's Super Four stage alongside India. The victory sets up another high-stakes clash between the two rivals on Sunday in Dubai. While Group A is settled, Group B remains open, with Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and Afghanistan vying for the remaining spots.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for September 18 - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha from Nuvama Professional Clients Group recommends buying Eicher Motors, JSW Infrastructure, and Manappuram Finance. Nifty's double bottom breakout suggests potential for 26000+ levels, while Bank Nifty could rally further.

title: ‘Great News for America’: Trump mocks Kimmel as ‘zero talent’; praises ABC for axe
content: Donald Trump celebrated ABC's suspension of Jimmy Kimmel's show, labeling Kimmel as having "zero talent." The suspension followed controversy over Kimmel's remarks about Charlie Kirk's death, with Nexstar refusing to air the show. FCC Chair Brendan Carr warned of potential license revocations, while Commissioner Anna Gomez criticized the administration's suppression of expression. This comes after CBS announced Stephen Colbert's show would end in 2026.

title: Pakistan vs UAE delayed by drama, but for players 'nothing else matters'
content: A rock-and-roll day in Dubai saw Pakistan's Asia Cup match against the UAE delayed due to a handshake controversy, with the PCB intervening after an issue with the match referee. Despite the off-field drama and initial threat of boycott, Pakistan secured a 41-run victory, advancing to the Super Four.

title: This 15-minute habit after every meal could slash your heart attack risk by 40%
content: Heart attacks, a major health concern, can be significantly reduced by incorporating a simple habit into daily life. Dr. Vassily suggests this 15-minute activity after each meal—breakfast, lunch, and dinner—can lower heart attack risk by up to 40%. This practice helps regulate blood sugar, improve fat metabolism, promote healthy blood flow, and boost energy levels.

title: Pennsylvania shooting: 3 officers killed, 2 seriously injured
content: In North Codorus Township, Pennsylvania, a devastating shooting claimed the lives of three police officers and critically injured two others. The officers were responding to a domestic-related investigation when the tragic incident occurred amidst rural farmland.

title: How gang abducted Ghaziabad trader’s son to Kannauj; ‘Nisha’ turns out to be Preeti
content: A 25-year-old man from Ghaziabad was abducted after being lured into a meeting by a woman he met on Instagram. The elaborate scheme involved stolen phones, swapped SIM cards, and ransom calls with disguised voices. The kidnappers initially demanded Rs 4 crore, later reducing it to Rs 50 lakh, before heading to collect the ransom.

title: FOMC meet: What does US Fed rate cut mean for Indian stock markets? Explained
content: Flagging risks of slowing economic growth and job gains, the US Federal Reserve cut rates by 25 basis points. US is the world's largest economy and any benchmark rate movement by its central bank has global implications.  Will the US Federal Reserve’s decision to cut rates spur a rally or will Nifty50 and BSE Sensex remain range-bound in the coming weeks?

title: 'It’s a genocide': Bernie Sanders labels Israel's military offensive in Gaza
content: US Senator Bernie Sanders has labeled Israel's military campaign in Gaza as a "genocide," marking him as the first sitting US senator to do so. Sanders called for an immediate ceasefire, humanitarian aid, and steps toward Palestinian statehood. He also urged an end to US military aid to the Israeli government, emphasizing accountability for Israeli leaders.

title: Bill Belichick’s girlfriend: DWTS exit to last-minute decision; Hudson’s claim revealed
content: Jordon Hudson, Bill Belichick's girlfriend, almost joined Dancing With the Stars, but the deal fell apart due to disagreements over her storyline. Hudson desired more creative control, including selecting her partner and limiting interviews, particularly those focusing on her relationship with Belichick. Her assertiveness has reportedly caused issues in other projects as well.

title: What amount of alcohol consumption is ok, as per top doctor
content: According to Dr Limaye, the human body transforms alcohol into dangerous substances through its breakdown process, which produces acetaldehyde as a toxic byproduct. Acetaldehyde creates DNA damage, while disrupting cell operations in the body. The disrupted cellular processes from alcohol consumption create higher cancer risks, because the body loses its ability to fight abnormal cells

title: Asia Cup | 'We are ready': Pakistan captain's rallying cry before India clash
content: Amidst controversy and tension, Pakistan's captain, Salman Ali Agha, asserts his team's readiness for the Super Four clash against India. Despite past incidents, including handshake disputes and standoffs, Salman emphasises the need for batting improvement, particularly in the middle order. He expresses confidence in the team's ability to overcome any challenge if they maintain their recent performance level.

title: What is Usain Bolt’s net worth in 2025
content: Usain Bolt's estimated net worth is $90 million in 2025. This reflects his athletic achievements and business ventures. Endorsements from Puma, Visa, and Gatorade contribute to his wealth. Bolt co-founded Bolt Mobility and expanded his restaurant chain. He faced financial challenges in 2023. Bolt enjoys family life in Kingston. His journey shows speed and resilience create lasting influence.

title: Destiny claims Elon Musk and other conservatives got him banned from Twitch
content: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.

title: What is Lyme disease? Bella Hadid seemingly shares photos from hospital bed
content: Bella Hadid recently shared vulnerable photos from a hospital bed, sparking concern among fans. Hadid, who has been open about her decade-long battle with Lyme disease, apologized for her absence. She has previously described extreme fatigue, joint pain, and mental health struggles related to Lyme disease and other conditions, including endometriosis and PCOS.

title: Molly Qerim leaves ESPN — Stephen A. Smith spills — shocking exit details
content: Molly Qerim has resigned from ESPN's First Take. Stephen A. Smith was unaware of her decision. Her exit has surprised many fans. Social media is full of theories about her departure. Contract negotiations reportedly broke down. ESPN wanted her to stay. Qerim hinted at her next move on Instagram. Her departure marks a major shift for First Take.

title: Report: Taylor Swift distressed by Kelce’s reaction to Chiefs loss
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about the intense public scrutiny affecting her fiancé, Travis Kelce. During a recent NFL game, Kelce's on-field frustration became headline news after he dropped a crucial pass. Sources reveal that the pressure of being linked to Swift has magnified every move Kelce makes, leading to unprecedented levels of attention.

title: 'Sick, dangerous': Trump labels Antifa 'terrorist organisation'; calls for funding probe
content: President Trump has announced his intention to designate Antifa as a terrorist organization following the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Tyler Robinson is set to be charged, with investigators highlighting his alleged Antifa links and anti-fascist slogans found at the crime scene.

title: Goa cops arrest Delhi man who said airport at Mopa ‘haunted’
content: Goa police arrested Akshay Vashisth in Delhi for posting a video titled ‘Goa ka haunted airport’ on his Facebook channel, ‘Real Talk Clips.’ The video contained false information about Manohar International Airport at Mopa, which was flagged by a police constable.

title: Maharashtra Sadan Scam: Chamankar brothers get relief as Bombay HC quashes PMLA case linked to Chhagan Bhujbal
content: The scam allegations arose from the awarding of contracts for construction of the Maharashtra Sadan in New Delhi, the High Mount Rest House in Mumbai, and buildings for the Regional Transport Office

title: Police vehicle rams into tea stall in central Delhi, man killed
content: Two police personnel who were in the Police Control Room (PCR) van have been apprehended. Their medical examination is being conducted

title: Bombay High Court initiates contempt proceedings against advocate Ojha for defaming sitting judge
content: The court has directed Mr. Ojha to submit a written statement within four weeks explaining why a formal charge should not be framed under the Contempt of Courts Act. The matter is scheduled for further hearing on October 16

title: Man drowns at Balkampet underpass following heavy rains in Hyderabad
content: The victim, identified as Mohammad Sharfuddin, a resident of Musheerabad, was riding his two-wheeler towards Begumpet when the force of gushing water knocked him down and carried him away

title: Women empowerment has always been a priority for PM Modi, says Sitharaman
content: A 15-day medical checkup will be conducted at 13,944 health camps in the State until October 2 as part of ‘Swasth Nari Sashakt Parivar Abhiyan’, says Naidu

title: Rahul Gandhi ‘explains’ how some communities are systematically targetted, disenfranchised | LIVE
content: Rahul Gandhi, on September 1, had said his party will soon come out with a “hydrogen bomb” of revelations about ‘vote chori’

title: Andhra Pradesh is the best bet for investors, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: With vast coastline, good air, road and rail connectivity, and industry-friendly policies, the State has the right industrial ecosystem, he says

title: Monsoon Session of A.P. Legislature to begin on September 18; YSRCP urged to attend proceedings
content: It is YSRCP legislators’ responsibility to represent the people’s concerns in the House, says Speaker; elaborate security arrangements in place for the session

title: Is age catching up with India’s dams?
content: Today, India faces the challenge of large parts of its hydrological infrastructure ageing en masse. According to the National Register of Large (Specified) Dams, some 1,065 were 50-100 years old and 224 were more than a century old in 2023. Many major dams of the post-1950 period are now in the last stages of their originally intended lifespan

title: Dubai's Burj Khalifa dazzles with greetings on PM Modi’s 75th birthday
content: The dazzling display drew attention from visitors and residents in Dubai, who captured the moment as the landmark shone with visuals honouring Mr. Modi.

title: Uttarakhand rains LIVE: 10 missing after landslide demolishes half a dozen homes in Uttarakhand
content: Rainfall in Uttarakhand’s Mussoorie causes severe damage to roads; hotels and homestays offer free accommodation to stranded tourists

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: Pilot's father seeks another probe saying AAIB findings tarnished his son's image
content: Pushkaraj Sabharwal said that the absence of a formal enquiry conducted in accordance with Rule 12 coupled with the selective information being provided to the media is very detrimental to him and affects his fundamental rights, including the right to reputation of his deceased son.

title: Share of U-rated films highest in Malayalam, lowest in Bhojpuri: Data
content: When it comes to A-rated content, only Telugu and Kannada language films crossed the 10% mark — the only two among Indian languages to do so

title: Tamil Nadu to continue to get light to moderate rains till Sunday
content: The rain is also likely to be accompanied by thunderstorm, lightning, and gusty wind speeds reaching 30-40 kmph at one or two places

title: TMC leader accused of assaulting acting headmaster inside school in Bengal’s Kakdwip
content: Opposition party leader in the State slams the ruling party and said that education system in Bengal is being destroyed under the current regime

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar transfers ₹802.46 crore to construction workers
content: Nitish Kumar transferred ₹5,000 per construction worker under the Annual Clothing Assistance Scheme and launched the web portal of the “Mukhyamantri Pratigya Yojna (Chief Minister Pledge Scheme)

title: Paint thrown at statue of Bal Thackeray’s wife Meenatai in Mumbai
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) Chief, the son of Meenatai Thackeray, reached the spot and criticised the incident, saying this is the work of a person who is either ashamed of his parents or attempting to burn Maharashtra

title: No person with degree will remain unemployed if voted to power: Tejashwi Yadav
content: The RJD leader claims the entire population of Bihar is angry with the current government as corruption and crime have increased so much that people don’t feel safe even in their own house

title: Over one crore saplings planted to celebrate PM’s birthday: Odisha CM Majhi
content: The State Government had mobilised all line departments, including educational institutes across the State to plant trees

title: Economic, linguistic barriers pose obstacles to poor in accessing courts, legal education: CJI
content: Chief Justice Gavai addresses barriers to justice for marginalised and vulnerable citizens, emphasising the need for linguistic inclusivity and legal education reform

title: India to start pilot projects in Venezuela
content: India and Venezuela to collaborate on pilot projects in agriculture, pharmaceuticals, and digital infrastructure amid rising tensions with the U.S.

title: Private boats operating from Marine Drive continue to violate safety rules
content: Boats plying with passengers crowded on the upper deck, most of them standing without wearing life jackets, a common sight nowadays at Marine Drive in Kochi

title: Hyderabad Mayor’s push paves way for school in 7,000-resident basti in Banjara Hills
content: With a resident population of about 7,000, the basti lacked a school and its children had to commute far, or were forced to drop out

title: Trump, Putin, Netanyahu, other global leaders greet PM Modi on his 75th birthday
content: Global leaders, including Meloni, the Dalai Lama, and Ursula von der Leyen, greeted PM Modi on his birthday and expressed their hope to enhance international relations

title: Minimal impact of Aarogyasri suspension in Telangana, says Health dept.
content: Suspension was announced by Telangana Aarogyasri Network Hospitals Association; 87% of empanelled hospitals continue providing treatment to patients under State health insurance programme

title: Finance Ministry notifies new Central GST tax rates
content: Effective from September 22, GST will be a two-tier structure, wherein majority of goods and services will attract tax of 5 and 18%

title: State floats tender to prepare master plan for a ‘Global City’
content: The State government, through TIDCO, proposes to develop this city that will serve as a premier international business, innovation, and lifestyle hub.

title: State Cabinet approves ‘CM With Me’ initiative to boost public-government interface and transparency
content: A key feature of the programme is the creation of a comprehensive Citizen Connect Centre, which will serve as a central hub for citizen feedback, grievance redressal and public communication

title: Raj Thackeray’s cartoon targets Amit Shah, son, over Indo-Pak match
content: The cartoon features the question in the background: “Who actually won? Who actually lost?” The post comes after India won in the recent Asia Cup match played against Pakistan.

title: Election Commission ready to roll out SIR in Karnataka anytime after Sept. 25
content: After the completion of SIR to remove dead, migrated and duplicate voters from rolls, the ECI expects the voting percentage in urban centres such as Bengaluru to go up in future election

title: Palaniswami has pledged AIADMK with the BJP, says Stalin
content: Mr. Palaniswami wants to safeguard himself from raids by Central agencies. He did nothing for the State when he was in power, and did not have the courage to raise his voice against the Centre to safeguard the interests of the State, says Tamil Nadu Chief Minister

title: Delhi court declines urgent hearing on Adani gag order, journalists decry takedown notices
content: In their appeals in the case, journalists have contended that the court passed an over-broad and all-encompassing restraining order without identifying which specific content was defamatory

title: Arguments on Gulmarg lease, PIL on environmental issues to be heard on next date of hearing: J&K High Court
content: In August, the High Court sought a final stand of government, following two separate opinions submitted by Raj Bhawan and Chief Minister’s Office in sealed covers

title: ORR infra woes: Industry veterans rally around tech firm
content: Prominent Bengalureans urge the State government to immediately intervene after trucking platform BlackBuck decided to move out of Bellandur on Outer Ring Road, citing traffic and commuting woes

title: Cabinet approves exclusive Ministry for Kalyana Karnataka region development
content: Sharanabasappa Darshanapur addresses gathering after unfurling National Flag to mark Kalyana Karnataka Utsav celebrations in Yadgir

title: Rains damage connecting roads to Mussorrie, hotels offer free stay to hundreds of stranded tourists
content: Hotel owners says over 3,000 travellers are stranded, unable to find their way to Dehradun; bid to fly patients from the ITBP helipad in Mussoorie fails; police ask people not to take out vehicles

title: Education Ministry tells CBSE, Central schools to screen film based on PM Modi’s childhood
content: Schools directed to screen Chalo Jeete Hain between September 16 and October 2; film will serve as case study on moral reasoning, help students reflect on character, service, responsibility, says Ministry

title: DPS Nacharam student injured after ‘birthday bumps’
content: The 14-year-old undergoes surgery after testicular damage; doctors advise three months of complete bed rest after which full recovery will be assessed; school staff, classmates booked

title: Hunger strike for Ladakh’s Statehood enters seventh day; will remain ‘apolitical’, say protesters
content: The Leh Apex Body said that it has decided to keep the movement “apolitical” and members of the Congress party associated with the movement have been asked to step down

title: Former Hurriyat chairman Abdul Gani Bhat, who held talks with NDA leaders two decades ago, passes away
content: Bhat, 89, was a staunch advocate of talks with both Indian and Pakistani governments; met BJP leader and then-Deputy PM L.K. Advani in 2004; slammed by Hurriyat for willingness to talk to New Delhi

title: Disha Patani Bareilly home firing: Two shooters killed in encounter
content: The encounter was carried out in a joint operation by Delhi Police Special Cell, Uttar Pradesh STF and Haryana STF, said officials

title: ED takes ex-MUDA Commissioner Dinesh Kumar into custody
content: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has taken former Commissioner of Mysuru Urban Development Authority (MUDA) G.T. Dinesh Kumar into custody

title: EU-India partnership set for upgrade
content: EU’s top diplomat Kaja Kallas releases strategic agenda on trade, technology, security, defence and climate; however, India’s military exercises with Russia and its continued purchase of Russian oil are seen in Brussels as potential obstacles to the deepening of the relationship with New Delhi

title: EVMs to display colour photographs of candidates beginning with Bihar polls
content: ECI has revised norms for EVM ballot papers; serial numbers of candidates will now be displayed more prominently, their faces will occupy three-fourths of photo space

title: Priyanka Gandhi dares through Nilambur forest in Kerala, visits tribespeople
content: Congress general secretary and Wayanad MP braved the forest’s challenging terrain with a handful of Congress leaders and officials, receiving guidance and support from tribal women who helped her navigate steep rocks

title: As Project Cheetah turns three, female cheetah relocated from Kuno to Gandhisagar
content: Gandhisagar now has three cheetahs, including two males who were moved there from Kuno in April this year

title: CPI(M) MP John Brittas raises concern over outsourcing operational backend work of parliamentary e-mail system to a private firm
content: The Rajya Sabha member argues that this move can compromise the confidentiality of communications sent by parliamentarians through their official email accounts

title: Catholic Church opposes BJP plan to celebrate PM Modi’s birthday inside church
content: Father Sebastian Arolichalil denounces poster circulating on social media. Says neither the church or the diocese has anything to do with it. He denies hosting any such function and condemns the poster featuring Muthalakkodom church.

title: Two construction workers killed as compound wall falls on them in Idukki
content: Munnar tahsildar says Revenue department in January had issued a stop memo for the construction work on the resort

title: Interim flood relief of ₹1,600 crore is ‘grave injustice’ to Punjab, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Opposition leader says State has suffered a loss of at least ₹20,000 crore, lakhs of people lost their houses and over four lakh acres of paddy crop got destroyed in the floods

title: Continuous reforms a must in armed forces, says CDS
content: Gen. Chauhan says it will ensure preparedness in an increasingly complex global security environment; reiterates armed forces’ commitment to remain self-reliant and future-ready

title: SC refuses to intervene in HC order on ‘Global Ayyappa Sangamam’
content: In its interim order on September 11, the High Court had allowed the event with certain conditions; it said the event did not spoil the sanctity of the temple or the river.

title: Mention Lingayat in religion column during survey, says mahasabha
content: The Dharwad unit of the Jagatika Lingayat Mahasabha has made an appeal to the followers of Basavanna

title: Which players do our experts hope to draft this season?
content: we asked each of them which five players they wanted to make sure they drafted this season . the findings give an indication of who some of the most coveted fantasy players and value picks might be in your drafts . it could be a sign that the demand is high and you might need to go a round (or two) higher to land them . this season Edwards has a monster season, perhaps even MVP-caliber, to try to lead the Timberwolves to the next level .

title: Bichette, Neto to miss rest of regular season
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the news cycle will constantly affect player values when viewed from a fantasy baseball perspective . 'make your picks Yordan Alvarez sprained his left ankle on Monday .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Mercury force Game 3, Lynx rally to sweep Valkyries
content: Phoenix defeats new york 86-60 to take game 2 . last year, all four first-round series ended in sweeps . both the Seattle Storm and Indiana Fever won to force their series to a decisive Game 3 .

title: WNBA championship, series odds: Lynx, Aces current title faves
content: the Minnesota Lynx enter the WNBA playoffs as the favorite to win the fifth championship in franchise history . the team's 16-game win streak to end the regular season is the longest in four years, according to ESPN Research . star A'ja Wilson wrapped up her second consecutive scoring title, after the Storm won Tuesday night .

title: Pak army chief ordered officers to attend Sindoor funerals: JeM man
content: Raj Shekhar Jha is a journalist for the Times of India with over a decade of experience in reporting on national security, terrorism, crime and prisons. title: All About Jimmy Kimmel, Talk Show Host Suspended Over Comments On Charlie Kirk
content: Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel's television show has been taken off the air "indefinitely" after criticism over his remarks on the killing of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

title: Obama Says US At 'Inflection Point' After Charlie Kirk Killing, Trump Divided Nation
content: Former President Barack Obama says that the United States is at "an inflection point" following the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk and that Trump has further divided the country rather than work to bring people together

title: 4-Year-Old Girl Sexually Assaulted In Mumbai School, 1 Arrested
content: A four-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted in the premises of a well-known school in Mumbai, leading to the arrest of a female staffer, a police official said on Wednesday.

title: In Poll-Bound Assam, Election Body Begins Voter Mapping Ahead Of Roll Revision
content: With Assam slated to go to the elections by April next year, the Election Commission has started a pre-Special Intensive Revision (SIR) voter mapping exercise in the state.

title: "Two Total Losers": After Kimmel, Trump Targets Jimmy Fallon, Seth Meyers
content: US President Donald Trump celebrated the indefinite suspension of Jimmy Kimmel's late-night talk show, using the opportunity to not only praise its cancellation but also to broaden his long-standing criticism of other late-night hosts.

title: Cloudburst In Uttarakhand's Chamoli Leaves 7 Missing, Washes Away 6 Houses
content: At least seven people have been reported missing after a cloudburst triggered by torrential rains struck Uttarakhand's Chamoli district, leaving behind a trail of destruction.

title: 'Jimmy Kimmel Live' Show Taken Off Air 'Indefinitely' Over Charlie Kirk Remarks
content: ABC has suspended Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show indefinitely following comments he made about Charlie Kirk's killing.

title: Charlie Kirk's Comment On Jimmy Kimmel Resurfaces After Show Taken Off Air
content: Hours after Jimmy Kimmel's show was taken off air by US network ABC over his remarks on Charlie Kirk's death, the right wing commentator's remarks on the host surfaced on social media.

title: US Citizen, 71, Who Came To Punjab To Marry NRI Man, 75, Burnt To Death
content: A 71-year-old woman, a US citizen of Indian origin, was allegedly killed shortly after she arrived here from Seattle to marry a 75-year-old UK-based NRI man, police said on Wednesday.

title: "MAGA Gang Desperately Trying...": Jimmy Kimmel Off Air Over Charlie Kirk Jab
content: Jimmy Kimmel made certain remarks on the killing of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk and criticised US President Donald Trump and FBI Director Kash Patel's handling of the investigation into the assassination.

title: Trump Designates Antifa 'Terror Organisation' Days After Charlie Kirk Murder
content: US President Donald Trump has designated Antifa a 'major terrorist organisation' and warned those funding Antifa of a thorough investigation "in accordance with the highest legal standards and practices."

title: Trump Names India, Pakistan, 21 Other Countries As Major Drug Transits
content: US President Donald Trump has named 23 countries as the major drug transit or major illicit drug-producing countries in a 'Presidential Determination' submitted to Congress.

title: What Is Antifa? Group Tagged "Terror Organisation" After Charlie Kirk Murder
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday announced that he is designating the left-wing group 'Antifa' as 'a major terrorist organisation' and also warnedthat those funding it will be investigated "with the highest legal standards and practices".

title: Lodha Developers' Former Director Arrested In Rs 85 Crore Fraud Case
content: Mumbai Police's Crime Branch has arrested Rajendra Narpatmal Lodha, a former director of Lodha Developers Limited, for his alleged involvement in a fraud worth Rs 85 crore, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Charlie Kirk Murder Suspect Feared Being Shot By Police, Says Sheriff
content: Tyler Robinson, the Utah man accused of assassinating Charlie Kirk, was afraid of being shot by police and eventually agreed to surrender only if it was done peacefully, a sheriff involved with taking him into custody said Wednesday.

title: Former Hurriyat Chief Abdul Gani Bhat Dies At 90
content: Former Hurriyat Conference chairman Abdul Gani Bhat, who was seen as a moderate among the separatist leadership, died at his Sopore residence on Wednesday. He was 90.

title: Russia Says It Advances On All Ukrainian Fronts
content: A senior Russian officer toured positions held by his troops in Ukraine on Wednesday and said Moscow's forces were advancing on all fronts, the Russian Defence Ministry.

title: FBI Chief Kash Patel Agrees To Probe Trump-Epstein Birthday Note
content: FBI Director Kash Patel has agreed to open an investigation into the birthday note that former President Donald Trump allegedly wrote to Jeffrey Epstein on his 50th birthday, The Hill reported.

title: Congress To Move No-Confidence Motion Against BJP-Led Government In Odisha
content: The opposition Congress on Wednesday announced to bring No Confidence Motion against the BJP-led state government during the upcoming monsoon session of the Odisha Assembly, scheduled to begin from Thursday.
